channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hollyland’s New And Affordable Lyra Webcam With 4K Images And Pro-Quality Sound
item.description: The Hollyland 4K Lyra webcam is designed for content creators, live streamers, educators and remote workers by offering the image quality of a mirrorl...

item.title: Microsoft Gave FBI Keys To Unlock Encrypted Data, Exposing Major Privacy Flaw
item.description: The tech giant said providing encryption keys was a standard response to a court order. But companies like Apple and Meta set up their systems so such...

item.title: Your Organization Isn’t Cyber Ready... It Just Thinks It Is
item.description: The organizations that will thrive in 2026 will be those that shatter the illusion of readiness and instead treat it as a living business metric.

item.title: FDA upgrades cookie recall to highest danger level over undeclared peanuts
item.description: The FDA upgraded the Gregory's Foods cookie dough recall to its most serious risk category over the potential presence of undeclared peanuts.

item.title: No ‘job apocalypse’: Goldman Sachs CEO denies the AI hiring nightmare is real
item.description: "Technology has been disrupting jobs, changing the way people work, destroying jobs ... for decades," David Solomon says.

item.title: The U.S. was ‘the operating system of the world,’ Scott Galloway says, but now ‘the American brand is chaos, corruption, and coercion’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: New Research Reveals That Therapy-Style AI Conversations Surprisingly Tend To Cause LLMs To Act Delusionally Toward Users
item.description: Clever research reveals that therapy-oriented AI chats can cause AI to act delusionally. The root is AI personas. I explain how it works. An AI Inside...

item.title: CEOs are bullish but nervous: David Solomon’s Davos readout on deregulation and ‘shotgun’ policy
item.description: Ahead of his own flight to Davos, CEO David Solomon sat with the Goldman Sachs Exchanges podcast for a temperature check.

item.title: When Is Chinese New Year 2026? It Begins With A ‘Ring Of Fire’ Solar Eclipse
item.description: Feb. 17’s new moon eclipses the sun and begins Lunar New Year, with Ramadan beginning the following day. Both are lunar festivals.

item.title: Demis Hassabis, and how AI just might wrangle our molecular universe
item.description: This week, Fortune published a magazine feature looking inside Demis Hassabis’s Isomorphic Labs.

item.title: Wall Street celebrates the end of Trump’s Greenland tariff threats and expects the Supreme Court will kill the rest of them
item.description: It's like the last few days never happened.

item.title: TikTok forms joint venture to keep operating in U.S., ending yearslong saga
I’m 75 and still working, but my job is boring. Can I retire with $830K in cash?
Consumer-sentiment data to follow flash readings on U.S. factories and services
These 20 stocks are strong choices for momentum investors
Fed's favored inflation gauge shows consumer prices remained elevated in November
item.description: The Commerce Department's delayed November PCE inflation report showed that inflation remained well above the Federal Reserve's 2% target rate.

item.title: US economy grew at fastest pace in 2 years in third quarter, fueled by consumer spending
item.description: The U.S. economy grew at a 4.4% growth in the third quarter of 2025, beating expectations of 3.3% as consumer spending and exports drive the strong pe...

item.title: Elon Musk says Tesla will likely sell humanoid robots by end of next year
item.description: Elon Musk said Tesla's Optimus humanoid robots could be available for public purchase by the end of 2027, saying the robots should be reliable, safe a...

item.title: Mortgage rates tick higher but remain near 3-year low
item.description: The average rate on a 30-year fixed mortgage rose this week to 6.09% according to the latest Freddie Mac data released on Thursday. That is up from la...

item.title: Bond investors should worry less about Treasury yields, and watch this instead
Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
